Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers needed to claim a series for the right to celebrate with fans in their own ballpark for the first time since 2018
The Padres had challenged the Dodgers in the division for months
The Dodgers had underperformed this season, committing $1.4 billion in one offseason only to win fewer than 100 games for the first time in a full season since the 2018 campaign
Key Match Events: Will Smith hit a home run to tie the game and redefine his season
Mookie Betts drove a Tanner Scott slider into right field for a two-run single
The Dodgers rallied with a five-run seventh inning to make it happen
Post-Match Reflections: Freeman highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Roberts said this feels a tick sweeter due to the adversity the team has faced this season
Others: Walker Buehler started the game on regular rest for the first time in 22 months
Shohei Ohtani added another to the tally of his 400 total bases in a season
